summary: Java-based website for an online social media networking service.
architectural_notes: Branding/UI: top header text should be "SpellCastersCCG" styled in green.
User Directory UI should not have a separate "Find People" section; search bar should be displayed adjacent to the tab controls.
User Directory (/directory) UI: remove the "Find People" section/label from the tab bar area.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and signed-in session handling so users can access authenticated features (profile, posts, friends).
Add user profile creation and editing for each authenticated user, including: display name, bio, profile picture, and cover photo.
Implement viewing other users’ public profiles and a basic user directory/search to find users to connect with.
Implement friend request workflow: send request, accept/decline request, cancel outgoing request, and display a friends list on user profiles.
Implement a chronological timeline of posts for each user profile, supporting text posts and optional photo attachments; display posts newest-first.
Add a home/feed view that aggregates posts from the signed-in user and their friends in reverse chronological order.

Create a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across pages (auth, profile, friends, feed). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add generated static placeholder assets (default avatar, default cover) and render them in the UI when a user has not uploaded images; store generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the top app header branding so the left-side brand element displays green text reading "SpellCastersCCG" instead of the current wordmark image, while keeping it as a link to the root route ("/").
Update the post composer UI so users publish the text they entered by clicking a clearly labeled primary submit button that reads "New Post".
Add a post composer to the authenticated user feed page so signed-in users can publish the text they enter as a new post directly from the feed.
Implement post comments so authenticated users can add comments under posts and view existing comments for each post in the feed and profile post lists.
Implement likes/reactions on posts so authenticated users can react to a post and see the total reaction count and their own reaction state.
Allow users to edit or delete their own posts, with authorization enforced by the backend.
Add an in-app notifications feature that records and displays notifications for friend requests and new comments, with read/unread state.
Add a basic Settings page where authenticated users can update their display name and at least one simple privacy option, and persist those settings via the backend.

Ensure authenticated users can access and view their personal profile page at the "/profile" route, showing their profile header (avatar, cover, display name, bio) and their own posts list, and providing an "Edit Profile" action.

Make the "My Profile" navigation entry discoverable on all screen sizes for authenticated users (including small/mobile viewports), so users can reliably navigate to their personal profile page without manually typing the URL.
Add a joined date to user profiles and render it on both the authenticated user's profile page and other users' profile pages.
Allow users to pin exactly one of their posts to the top of their own profile, and display a pinned post section at the top of profile post lists when a pin exists.
Update React Query hooks and cache invalidation to support follow counts and pin/unpin actions, keeping profile pages responsive and consistent after mutations.
Replace the stubbed frontend user search hook with a real React Query hook that calls the new backend user search method and returns matching profiles for the current search query.
Update the User Directory page to use backend-powered searching (instead of client-side filtering over an empty/stubbed list) and show appropriate loading and empty states.
Allow authenticated users to follow/unfollow users directly from the user search results.

Update the User Directory page ("/directory") UI to remove the standalone "Find People" section header and instead present a compact top row where the search input is displayed inline to the right of the page’s tab controls.
Ensure the updated User Directory layout preserves existing loading, empty, and results states, and that all user-facing text remains in English.

Remove the navigation item labeled "Find People" from the authenticated app header navigation (both the desktop header button group and the mobile slide-out menu), so it no longer appears in the tab/navigation bar UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: User accounts and authentication for the social networking website
User profile creation and customization (profile picture, cover photo, bio)
Friend request workflow and friends list displayed on user profiles
Chronological timeline/feed of user posts and photos
Update the top header to display green text reading "SpellCastersCCG"
Add a "New Post" button to publish a text post that the user has entered
In the home/user feed, allow users to publish the text they enter as a post
Add comments under posts so users can interact
Add likes/reactions on posts
Allow users to edit or delete their own posts
Add notifications (e.g., friend requests, comments)
Add a basic settings page (e.g., update display name, privacy options)
Add a simple profile settings screen
Allow authenticated users to view their own personal profile page
Show follower and following counts on user profile pages
Display a "joined date" on user profile pages
Allow users to pin one of their posts at the top of their profile
Add backend support for follow relationships and expose follower/following counts for any user profile.
Allow users to search other users by display name and follow them from search/results
Add backend support to search/browse user profiles by display name so the frontend user directory is not a stub and can return real results.
Add backend query support for follow relationship state so the frontend can render correct Follow/Unfollow controls for a given target user.
Update User Directory UI: remove the "Find People" section and place the search bar inline next to the tab sections
